page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: The 1985 Domesday Survey of{Montrose} attempts in brief compass to highlight some of the issues which form part of the contemporary scene. In-depth treatment has not been possible because of constraints as regards the length of each article imposed on the research team.{ {Montrose}is an ancient{Royal Burgh,} now administered by Angus District Council. It is bounded on the North by the River North Esk; on the South by the River South Esk; on the West by Montrose Basin and on the East by the North Sea. Much of the underlying soil in the East of the town is sand,while that of the West is formed of alluvial clay. {Montrose}is situated astride the A92 road and is served by the North Eastern Region of British Rail.
